title: Looking for a designer who crosses out words/lines in long bits of text to create illustrations
content:
As title says - I'm looking for a designer who crosses out words/lines in long bits of text (newspapers I think) to create illustrations (pretty sure the ones I saw were portraits).

I've seen their work before, but can't remember for the life of me their name. Really annoying as I really need their stuff for a main bit of research in a small university project.

Anyone know who I am talking about?

Hope I have explained it well - if not let me know, and I'll try reword it!
author: buda

comments.content: You might also like this poster: [http://www.cuminthestreets.com/fontshop.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100116142722/http:/www.cuminthestreets.com/fontshop.html) :-)

I thought you meant [Tom Phillips.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100116142722/http:/humument.com/gallery/index.html)

Nick Cooke
